isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - FRONT DRIVE AXLE: SPICER S-9000 - DIFFERENTIAL REASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: DIFFERENTIAL REASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: Use Figure 3 as a reference to assemble the differential.

step1.para: Apply a small amount of lubricant to all mating surfaces. Refer to LUBRICATION for the correct lubricant. This will keep thrust washers in place during assembly and provide initial lubrication ( Figure 40).
Place thrust washer and side gear in left hand differential case ( Figure 41).

figure.caption: Figure 41. Thrust Washer and Side Gear in Diff Case

step1.para: Assemble differential pinions and thrust washers on cross shaft. Place assembly in left hand differential case ( Figure 42).

figure.caption: Figure 42. Assembly in Left Hand Differential Case

step1.para: Place remaining side gear and thrust washers in position on differential pinions ( Figure 43).

figure.caption: Figure 43. Remaining Side Gear and Thrust Washers on Diff Pinions

step1.para: Assemble case halves, making sure match marks are lined up ( Figure 44).

note.para: If case halves were not matched, align the quadrants that have the three machined holes.

step1.para: Install case bolts and nuts. Tighten alternately and evenly to 75 to 90 ft-lbs. (102 to 122 Nm) torque ( Figure 45).

figure.caption: Figure 45. Install Case Bolts and Nuts

step1.para: Install side bearing cones to differential case hubs.

caution.para: Use of press and proper adapter is preferred to eliminate possible damage to bearings.
